techmeme.title: Filings: CFPB employees say the agency's Trump-appointed leadership plans to fire nearly all its 1,700 employees while "winding down" the agency (Hugh Son/CNBC)
Microsoft says it will shut down Skype on May 5 and directs users to migrate all their contacts and chat data to Teams; Skype had 36M+ DAUs in 2023 (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
AMD unveils the $549 Radeon RX 9070 and $599 Radeon 9070 XT GPUs, featuring 16GB of GDDR6 memory, PCIe 5.0, and FSR 4 support, shipping March 6 (The Verge)
Experts say stopping North Korean thefts will require higher security spending by crypto exchanges, more stringent rules, and better government cooperation (Bloomberg)
Reports of Meta launching standalone Meta AI and Reels apps aren't surprising, as the company has a history of repeatedly bundling and unbundling its products (M.G. Siegler/Spyglass)
